subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
msgSnippet: I am using Junit3.7 version with JDK1.3. Does 3.7 compensate the JDK1.4? Joan ... Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at http://explorer.msn.com
messageBody:
I am using Junit3.7 version with JDK1.3.  Does 3.7 compensate the JDK1.4?

Joan

>From: "Jason Rogers"
>Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>To: "'junit@yahoogroups.com'"
>Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
>Date: Thu, 14 Jun 2001 17:38:44 -0400
>
>There is a new release coming out (maybe is out already) that compensates
>for this.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: ehusby@... [mailto:ehusby@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 5:36 PM
> > To: Junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.4
> >
> >
> > As an experiment, knowning that Java 1.4 now has support
> > for assertions, I
> > decided to try compiling a program
> > with the latest beta release.
> >
> > All my unit test code got flagged with warnings stating
> > "as of release 1.4,
> > assert is a keyword, and may not be used as an identifier."
> >
> > Does anyone know what the Junit plans are in this regard?
> >
> >
> >
> >

> > junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
> >

> > http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
